text: I spent last weekend trying to fix a bug that had been driving me crazy for weeks. Turns out it was a missing semicolon. Three days of my life I'll never get back. The debugger kept pointing to the wrong line and I was convinced it was a memory issue.

My grandmother's recipe for apple pie doesn't have exact measurements. She'd say 'a handful of flour' and 'sugar until it tastes right.' I've tried to write it down properly but it never comes out the same when I measure everything precisely.

The subway was packed this morning. Some guy's backpack kept hitting me in the face every time the train lurched. I thought about saying something but he had headphones in and looked stressed. We all just stood there pretending it wasn't happening.

You've built an AI agent and deployed it to production. It works great until you need additional capabilities. Then you're back to coding, adding tools manually. What if the agent could just build the tool it needs, right when it needs it?

The meeting ran two hours over. Karen from accounting kept asking questions that were already answered in the slides. I watched three people fall asleep. My coffee went cold. This could have been an email.
